recommendations: Increase calorie intake with nutrient-dense foods.
Include a variety of whole grains, such as brown rice, quinoa, and oats.
Incorporate healthy fats from sources like avocados, nuts, and olive oil.
Focus on lean protein sources like chicken, turkey, fish, eggs, and legumes.
Include dairy or dairy alternatives for calcium and vitamin D.
Eat frequent, smaller meals throughout the day to boost calorie consumption.
Snack on nuts, seeds, and dried fruits for extra calories and nutrients.
Stay hydrated with water, and consider adding nutrient-rich smoothies or shakes.
Consult with a nutritionist for a personalized plan based on your dietary preferences and health goals.

foods: Oatmeal with sliced bananas and a tablespoon of almond butter
Quinoa salad with mixed vegetables and grilled chicken
Salmon with sweet potato and steamed broccoli
Whole grain roll with olive oil for dipping
Hummus with carrot and cucumber sticks
Trail mix with dried fruits and seeds
